We always knew the CEO's corner office at Googleplex was no place for an acerbic wit like Eric Schmidt 's. Say something like The Google policy on a lot of things is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it. I would argue that implanting something in your brain is beyond the creepy line- at least for the moment, until the technology gets better onstage during a product demo, and you're a PR nightmare.
